dialogue.text: Go on then, ask your questions!
Uh... So you are a drummer? Sorry, that wasn't really a question..
Yes, I am a drummer. What of it?
*oh no. I'm going to choke*
Don't forget to breathe, friend.
How... did you get into it?
Ahh, excellent question. You see, I used to be a taiko drummer for the yakuza...
*WHAT DOES THAT EVEN MEAN*
Life was... chaotic, loud, violent and I was full of anger.
One day my nerves got the better of me and I failed to the play the boss's favorite song correctly.
So I was banished.
What does a banished yakuza drummer even do after that?
*Is this really a conversation that I'm having or did I pass out again*
Well, I was never able to get the sound of my mistake out of my head.
So one day I decided to punish myself by sitting underneath a powerful waterfall...
*Doesn't he realize that it's much easier to just beat yourself up in your head?*
I found myself struggling to breathe as the cold deluge of water cascaded over me.
Something about it...
The way I was forced to focus on my breathing...
It washed away all the noise from my head.
From then on, drumming was different.
It became a way of finding peace.
Wow. That's... incredible.
Thank you. Drumming's more than just beating a drum.
It's about finding a rhythm that calms- or ignites- your spirit.
That is what my music means to me.
*He's right... Maybe music can help me find peace, too.*
